Nakshatras are the 27 lunar mansions in Vedic astrology. Your birth nakshatra is determined by the Moon's position at birth and reveals your personality, destiny, and spiritual path.
There are 27 Nakshatras in Vedic astrology, each with a ruling deity, planet, and symbol that influences your nature and life path.
Panchangam is the Hindu almanac with five elements: Tithi (lunar day), Vara (weekday), Nakshatra (birth star), Yoga, and Karana. It guides auspicious timing for important events.
The Panchangam helps find Muhurtham (auspicious times) for weddings, business launches, and ceremonies based on planetary positions and lunar phases.
Rahu Kalam is a daily inauspicious period of 90 minutes. By day: Sun 4:30-6PM, Mon 7:30-9AM, Tue 3-4:30PM, Wed 12-1:30PM, Thu 1:30-3PM, Fri 10:30AM-12PM, Sat 9-10:30AM.
Rahu Kalam should be avoided for starting new ventures, weddings, or important ceremonies. Regular daily activities are fine during this time.

Muhurtham is an auspicious time window based on Panchangam. A good muhurtham avoids Rahu Kalam and ensures the Lagna and Moon are well-placed. Best nakshatras for weddings: Rohini, Mrigashira, Hasta, Anuradha.
To find a good muhurtham, astrologers verify Tithi, Nakshatra, and planetary positions are favorable while avoiding malefic periods.
A birth chart (Jathagam/Kundali) is a snapshot of the sky at your birth. It maps 9 planets across 12 houses, each ruling a life area like wealth, career, relationships, and health.
Your birth chart has 12 Bhavas (houses) and 9 Navagrahas (planets). The Lagna (Ascendant) shapes your personality; the Moon sign (Rasi) governs your emotions.

patterns: Which sign am I compatible with
responses: Compatibility in Vedic astrology uses Rasi matching and Nakshatra Ashtakoota (8-fold matching). Fire signs match Air signs. Earth signs harmonize with Water signs. Tell me your rasi for specifics!
Tamil marriage compatibility uses Porutham (10 criteria) including Dina, Gana, Rasi, Yoni, and Rajju. At least 6 poruthams are needed for a good match.
Mangal Dosha (Chevvai Dosham) occurs when Mars is in the 1st, 2nd, 4th, 7th, 8th, or 12th house. Remedies include marrying another Mangalik, Kumbh Vivah ritual, or worshipping at Mangal temples.
Chevvai Dosham effects are nullified if both partners have the dosha. Modern astrologers consider it one factor among many, not a deal-breaker.
Astrological remedies include: gemstone therapy, mantra chanting, temple poojas, charity on specific days, fasting on planet days, Yantra worship, and wearing specific colors.
By planet remedies: Sun — wear Ruby, offer water at sunrise. Moon — wear Pearl, offer milk. Mars — wear Red Coral. Rahu — donate black sesame. Ketu — worship Ganesha.
The 9 Navagrahas: Sun (soul), Moon (mind), Mars (energy), Mercury (intellect), Jupiter (wisdom), Venus (love), Saturn (karma), Rahu (ambition), Ketu (spirituality). Each rules specific life areas.
Jupiter is the great benefic bringing luck. Saturn teaches through discipline. Venus governs love. Mars provides energy and drive. The Moon shapes daily moods.

Saturn (Shani) is the planet of karma and discipline. Sade Sati is a 7.5-year period when Saturn transits your Moon sign, bringing lessons and growth. Remedy: Offer sesame oil, worship Hanuman on Saturdays.
Saturn's 19-year dasha rewards patience and hard work. Sade Sati brings challenges but ultimately transforms your life. Serve others, stay disciplined, and avoid major risks during this period.

patterns: When will I get a job
responses: Career prospects come from the 2nd house (wealth), 6th house (work), 10th house (career), and 11th house (income). A strong Jupiter and 10th lord indicate professional success.
Financial luck improves during Jupiter's favorable transit or during the dasha of your 10th or 11th house lord. Mercury rules business and communication-based careers.
The Moon governs mind and emotions. A weak Moon causes mood swings and anxiety. Saturn during Sade Sati brings heaviness. Remedy: Meditate during full moon, chant Moon mantras, spend time near water.
Planetary health rulerships: Sun — heart and eyes, Moon — mind, Mars — blood, Mercury — nerves, Jupiter — liver, Venus — kidneys, Saturn — bones. Balancing through mantras improves wellness.
